bibl.note: Discusses the arguments in the Sappho poem, P. Colon. Inv. 21351 + 21376 (= M.-P.3 1449.01; LDAB 10253). The first argument uses the myth of Tithonus as a proof that aging is inevitable in humans. It states that the aging of Tithonus was due to the mistake of the goddess of dawn wherein she forgot to ask the god Zeus for immortality and eternal youth.
